events.title: Elevated Blood Pressure
events.description: During a clinical examination, the patient exhibited elevated blood pressure readings of 155/75 mmHg, indicating potential hypertension. This finding is significant as it may require further monitoring and management to prevent cardiovascular complications.

events.title: Diabetic Foot Examination
events.description: A comprehensive diabetic foot examination revealed multiple abnormalities: the right foot was ulcerated, and the left foot was at moderate risk. Additionally, the 10g monofilament sensation test indicated abnormal results for both feet, highlighting the risk of diabetic neuropathy and potential complications.

events.title: Critical Lower Limb Ischaemia
events.description: The patient was diagnosed with critical lower limb ischaemia, a severe condition that can lead to limb loss if not addressed promptly. This diagnosis necessitates urgent intervention and management to restore blood flow and prevent further complications.

events.title: Lower Limb Ischaemia
events.description: A new episode of lower limb ischaemia was noted, indicating a significant vascular issue that may require further evaluation and treatment to prevent progression to more severe conditions.

events.title: Elevated Pulse Rate
events.description: The patient's pulse rate was recorded at 108 bpm during a clinical examination, which is above the normal range. This tachycardia may indicate underlying health issues that require further investigation.
